title: Substance abuse testing procedures and interpretation of test results
context: ยง329B-5 Substance abuse testing procedures and interpretation of test results. (a) Prior to the collection of any sample for substance abuse testing, the individual to be tested shall receive a written statement of the specific substances to be tested for and a statement that over-the-counter medications or prescribed drugs may result in a positive test result. (b) In accordance with this section, the director shall adopt rules pertaining to: (1) The qualifications, responsibilities, and licensing of the medical review officer; (2) The method of transmittal of laboratory test results and any interpretations of test results to the third party and the tested individual; and (3) The obtaining, disclosure, and confidentiality of substance abuse testing information. &copy; No laboratory, including a substance abuse on-site screening location, may test for any substance not included on the written statement containing the specific substances to be tested for. (d) As used in this section, &ldquo;test results&rdquo; means laboratory test results or the results of substance abuse on-site screening tests.
